turkishSentence: Johan iki haftadan fazla bir süredir İngiltere'de.
englishSentence: Johan has been in England for more than two weeks now.

turkishSentence: Peter, dokuz yaşndan beri en iyi arkadaşım.
englishSentence: Peter has been my best friend since we were nine years old.
I haven't been at the cinema for two hours.
George and Sally have been married for 50 years.

turkishSentence: Genç çocuk dünden beri çok mutlu.
englishSentence: The young boy has been very happy since yesterday.
Frank has been at that company for many years.

turkishSentence: udy ve ben geçen yıldan beri aynı sınıftayız.
englishSentence: Judy and I have been in the same class since last year.
Our friends have been on their summer holidays since June.

turkishSentence: George, altı yaşından beri iyi bir futbolcu.
englishSentence: George has been a good football player since he was six years old.
The dog has been under the table for three hours.
He has been very funny among his friends for years.

turkishSentence: Kız kardeşim çocukluğundan beri iyi bir yüzücü.
englishSentence: My sister has been a good swimmer since she was a child.

turkishSentence: Susan, son on aydır teniste iyi.
englishSentence: Susan has been good at tennis for last ten months.
She hasn 't been at home since morning.
I've been in London for three years.
How long have you been a manager?
His money has been in the bank for four years.
This statue has been in the square since 1995.
The proposal has been in the drawer for weeks.

turkishSentence: Yıllık plan, beş gündür yöneticinin masasında.
englishSentence: The annual plan has been on manager's table for five days.

turkishSentence: Üvey kız kardeşi dün geceden beri sınav sonucundan endişeli.
englishSentence: Her step sister has been worried about the exam result since last night.
My father's friend has been retired for seven years.

turkishSentence: Yakın arkadaşı geçen haftadan beri anne.
englishSentence: Her close friend has been a mother since last week.
The books have been on the shelf for years.
Their ambition has been stable for five years.
How long has he been on a holiday?
They have been sad since last match.
The letters have been ready to post for days.
Her neighbor's daughter has been a doctor since 2015.
The broken phone has been in the drawer for two weeks.

turkishSentence: Gazete sabahtan beri kapının önünde mi?
englishSentence: Has the newspaper been in front of the door since morning?
How long has she been in the hairdressser's?

turkishSentence: Annesi beş saattir misafirleri ile mi?
englishSentence: Has his mother been with her guests for five hours?
Her friends haven't been at school since yesterday.

turkishSentence: Kevin o zamandan beri yönetici değil.
englishSentence: Kevin hasn't been a manager since then.
Julia hasn't been married for two years.

turkishSentence: Delegeler sabahtan beri çok önemli bir toplantıdalar.
englishSentence: The delegates have been at a very important meeting since morning.

turkishSentence: Bu fabrikadaki işçiler iki haftadır grevdeler.
englishSentence: The workers in this factory have been on strike for two weeks.
The computer has been broken since last week.
The list of price has been in the file for three days.
Have you been in hospital for four hours?
Has she been with you since noon?
Why has he been in here for hours?

turkishSentence: Bir saattir tahtada zor sorular var.
englishSentence: There have been difficult questions on board for an hour.
The meals of this restaurant have been delicious for years.
The frames of the photos on the wall have been dusty for weeks.
The medications have been in the bag for two days.
Have you been happy with them for days?
They have been in a bad situation since last week.

turkishSentence: Ofis için kırtasiye malzemeleri dünden beri masanın üzerinde.
englishSentence: The stationery tools for the office have been on the desk since yesterday.
The best solution has been in his mind for days.

turkishSentence: Uçak bileti saat ikiden beri yanında değil.
englishSentence: The flight ticket hasn't been with him since two o'clock.

turkishSentence: Hastanın raporu dünden beri doktorun masasında.
englishSentence: The report of the patient has been on the table of doctor since yesterday.
He has been richer for last two years.
Where have you been since last Tuesday?
They have been at home due to epidemic for one month.

turkishSentence: Öğretmen üç saattir sınıfta öğrencileriyle birlikte.
englishSentence: The teacher has been with her students in the class for three hours.
Our goods have been in the storage for months.

turkishSentence: Kız kardeşimin arkadaşı on dakikadır arabada değil.
englishSentence: My sister's friend hasn 't been in the car for ten minutes.
The dictionary hasn 't been on the desk for minutes.
Their baby has been in the cradle for hours.
Have they been at the concert for two hours?
Breakfast has been ready for ten minutes.

turkishSentence: Alışveriş merkezi sabahtan beri çok kalabalık.
englishSentence: The mall has been very crowded since morning.
His hands have been dirty for an hour.

turkishSentence: Bir grup insan saatlerdir kamp ateşinin etrafında.
englishSentence: A group of people have been around the camp fire for hours.
Milk has been in the fridge for half an hour.
The orders have been on the secretary's computer for days.
Has she been in the balcony since noon?

turkishSentence: Arabanın anahtarı iki buçuk saattir cebinde.
englishSentence: The key of the car has been in his pocket for two and half hours.

turkishSentence: Biberon on beş dakikadır bulaşık makinesinde.
englishSentence: The feeding bottle has been in the dish washer for fifteen minutes.
The famous actor has been cancer for three months.

turkishSentence: O toplantıdaki kararlar yıllardır adil değil.
englishSentence: Decisions at that meeting haven't been fair for years.
I have been responsible for products since 2017.
His mother has been at the supermarket since four o'clock.
Has she been at the dentist's for two hours?
Ice-cream has been in deep freeze since yesterday.

turkishSentence: Kırılan bardaklar geçen haftadan beri çöp kutusunda.
englishSentence: The broken glasses have been in the rubbish box since last week.
How long have they been at the cinema?
The computer has been on for twenty minutes.

turkishSentence: Gençliğimden beri ekonomik olarak ailemden bağımsızım.
englishSentence: I have been economically independent of my parents since my youth.
The orchestra has been on the stage for four hours.
Soldiers have been in the pit since morning.
His sister has been shy since her childhood.
The kids have been in the garden for five hours.
Haven't you been a father for two years?

turkishSentence: Paraları geçen yıldan beri bu bankada değil mi?
englishSentence: Hasn't their money been in this bank since last year?

turkishSentence: Neden son iki gündür fuarda değiller?
englishSentence: Why haven't they been at the fair for last two days?

turkishSentence: O şirkette ne kadar süredir mühendis?
englishSentence: How long has she been an engineer in that company?
Doctors have been in the operating room for three hours.
His followers have been angry for days.
The socks have been in the basket since last week.

turkishSentence: Güzel şarkılar iki saattir en sevdiğim radyo kanalında.
englishSentence: Good songs have been on my favorite radio channel for two hours.

turkishSentence: Bazı oyuncular yarım saattir yedek kulübesinde.
englishSentence: Some players have been on the bench for half an hour.

turkishSentence: Son beş yıldır bu şirkette yönetici.
englishSentence: He has been an executive in this company for last five years.
The key has been with me since moming.

turkishSentence: Bilgisayardaki klasörler dünden beri sunum için hazır.
englishSentence: The folders on the computer have been ready for the presentation since yesterday.
The child in the garden has been in mud for minutes.

turkishSentence: Bu binadaki komşular geçen haftadan beri çok gürültülü.
englishSentence: Neighbors in this building have been ver noisy since last week.

turkishSentence: Kırmızı kalemim günlerdir kalem kutusunun içinde değil.
englishSentence: My red pencil hasn't been in the pencil case for days.
